result.execSummary:
The defendant Kevin A Whitely Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Kevin A Whitely Jr is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Kevin A Whitely Jr was found guilty of Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Consec to 20CF991. Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program. Defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.
Consecutive to: 20CF991

superMiscConds.notes: $250 DNA surcharge and court costs remitted. $92 VW surcharge to be collected by the Dept of Corrections.
Defendant shall not threaten or direct any acts of physical violence toward anyone. Do not drive a motor vehicle without valid DL.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin A Whitely Jr

records.addlTxt: of representation
Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 9/29/22 sent electronically to DCJ and DOC.

*IN CUSTODY*
Defendant Kevin A Whitely in court, in custody.  Attorney Erin Nagy in court for Kevin A Whitely.  Attorney Will Davis in court for State of Wisconsin. Jt: plea ct 1. DISM cts 2, 3, repeater on count 1. Argued sentencing. State recommending 3 years WSP, 1ic, 2es cs to any other sentence. Defense recommending 1 year DCJ to be served in WSP. Statement by DE. DNA on file.

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT # 1
Court sentences DE to:
-serve 2.5 years  in WSP, bifurcated into:
-initial confinement: 1 year
-extended supervision: 18 months
-cs to 20CF991

Challenge Incarceration Program: Eligible
Substance Abuse Program: Eligible

CONDITIONS

-No threats/acts of violence against: anyone
-Do not drive a MV w/o valid DL

-DNA on file

-Undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent

-Complete MRT 

COURT COSTS:
Ct # 1
- All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge due on ES and through prison wages

CREDIT
-Days credit for time served:  0
-Days credit to Prison: 0

-DE advised of post-conviction rights

Becky K

CORRECTION 9/29/22
Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count(s) 1.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count # 2, 3, REPEATER ON CT 1  . 

Becky K
Letter in support of defn
Notice of right to seek postconviction relief
Letter in support of defn
Plea/sentencing hearing on September 29, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Court reschedules for Attorney Nagy to get appointed on all cases.
Status conference on August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Status conference on August 9, 2022 at 10:00 am.

Defendant in court with Attorney Erin Nagy.  Patrick Winter appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Jurek to withdraw on cases he is assigned to so that Attorney Nagy can be attorney of record on all cases. Court to schedule SEHR and STC.

Pre-trial conference on June 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Kevin A Whitely Jr
Current: Dane Co Jail,   (Effective: 04-14-2022)
Prior: 2569 Roanoke Cir, Fitchburg, WI 53711
Court entered not guilty plea for defendant. Motions due 20 days. Bail continued.
BR 11

Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Erin Nagy.  Frank J. Remington appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requested counts 1-3 found transactionally related. No objection. Counts 1-3 found transactionally related.  Witness T.S. sworn and testified. Direct exam by the State. Venue established. DE identified. Cross exam by Atty Nagy. Witness excused. Motions by the State. Response by Atty Nagy. Court made findings and probable cause found.
Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 3/22/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

The Court ordered a signature bond on the condition that the defendant reports to and complies with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall immediately call the Pretrial Services offices at 283-2951 upon his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Your signature bond is set in the amount of $500 per case. You may be responsible for paying this amount if you miss a court date or do not follow conditions of your release.
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services

02:28 PM Defendant Kevin A Whitely in court, in custody, with attorney Devonte Windham who appears by special appearance on behalf of Attorney Erin Nagy. Prosecuting Atty Carl Lazarus appeared for State of Wisconsin.  State requesting setover; Deputy is unable to attend in-person today; currently out-of-state.  ADA has no objection to revisiting DE's bail/bond.  Atty Windham objects to setover; time limits have not been waived.  Response by ADA Lazarus.  Argument presented by Atty Windham for dismissal of case or moving forward w/PH today.  Court finds good cause and grants request for setover; State should have witness available at next PH or case could be dismissed.

02:28 PM Defendant Kevin A Whitely in court, in custody, with attorney Devonte Windham (special appearance). Prosecuting Atty Carl Lazarus appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Discn on record regarding bond modification to allow for signature bond.  Court grants request for signature bond with the following conditions:   1)  do not operate any motor vehicles;  2) particpate in Pretrial Services.
Preliminary hearing on April 14, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Atty Erin Nagy
Zoom
Preliminary hearing on March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
Parties did not stipulate to waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.

02:22 PM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Schuyler S Boggio.  Colleen Lennon appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties by Zoom. The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading. Court entered Not Guilty pleas as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 22, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
